186041669.review: I first played Dead Island during the Xbox 360 days and spent a lot of time inside its world, though never played the sequel. Dead Island Riptide Definitive Edition does an admirable job following up that game. Technically wise, this version of the game is pretty sound though I have run into a handful of instances where progress glitched. This has mostly happened during the siege defense moments, where hordes of zombies attack your position. Otherwise, I have not encountered other issues. This game is still as fun as the original Dead Island and I highly recommend it to anyone who is a fan of zombies. Grab a friend to play it and you both will have a blast!

186007531.review: Крутая игра с другом пройти с кувалдой зомби убивать

185980615.review:
Um jogo de zumbi que aparentava ser bom, mas que acaba sendo apenas fraco !!!

Como fã de jogos de zumbi, fiquei animado para experimentar Dead Island: Riptide, esperando uma aventura emocionante de zumbi. Infelizmente, minha experiência acabou sendo bastante frustrante.

Assim que aprendi os comandos no tutorial, tive uma péssima primeira impressão. Continuei por gostar da temática e ver como seria a estória. Infelizmente, a trama é fraca e os personagens são pouco desenvolvidos, dificultando a conexão emocional. Finalizei a campanha em cerca de 15 horas. Conforme avançava, o jogo ficava um pouco melhor, mas a dificuldade aumentava devido aos comandos nada responsivos, tornando minha experiência frustrante. 

Conclusão: Dead Island Riptide foi uma jornada cansativa e frustrante, só completei por gostar da temática de zumbi. Não recomendo, mas para quem gosta de jogos de zumbi pode encontrar algum divertimento. 

- Nota: 4/10

185940010.review:
7/10
More Dead Island. If you want more Dead Island here it is. This game doesn't add much more in terms of game play. I prefer the atmosphere and location of the first game. In the second half of the game. When you get to Oldtown you can really see the DNA of Techland's next game "Dying Light". The city looks a lot like Harran and the way it is verticle, all the survivors living on rooftops, you can really see where they got the parkour/free running idea for Dying light. The last boss was extremely silly. The story is pretty weak, but you're not here for a compelling story are you? You're here to kill Zombies.

185722148.review:
Let's see.. My first suspicion that I wouldn't enjoy this was when I tried to navigate the main menu. My mouse movements barely registered, and when I looked around to see if I could do something about it I found TWO sliders for mouse sensitivity. One for the menu and one for the game. Default was set in the middle, and I had to slide it all the way up to max to _almost_ get the mouse to work and feel right. Then I set the slider for the game at max too.

..But when the cutscenes were done, it was obvious that now mouse sensitivity was WAY too high. So in order for the mouse sensitivity to be the same both in the menu and in the game, there are two sliders that I need to have on WAY different settings? I AM NOT IMPRESSED.

At least I got the game started, right? It can still be fun, right? Well, that depends on how masochistic I am. Which I'm not.

The navigation is a PAIN. Trying to figure out where I'm going is not helped by the "GPS." The UI is unintuitive and.. boring. Having interactable stuff highlighted while I'm still a mile away isn't fun - it's insulting. I managed to find some stuff, go places, and then started running into enemies. I couldn't switch weapons, because (this I discovered mid-fight) the sensitivity for the mouse scroll wheel was RIDICULOUS - and couldn't be changed. 

I didn't even finish the intro - the game was that bad. To say I am disapppointed is an understatement.

185264911.review:
The weakest entry of the main franchise - but still a good game.

Dead Island: Riptide is a standalone game, but also a direct sequel to Dead Island 1. This game's plot won't make much sense if you haven't played the previous game first.
The mechanics and graphics are slightly improved compared to the first game, but they are mostly the same. The plot is weaker and both the NPCs and the newly introduced main character are less interesting than in the first game. It's especially aggravating that this game opens many plot strings that are never closed, not even in Dead Island 2 many years later. 

Nevertheless, it's a solid game. If you're a fan of the franchise, Dead Island: Riptide is a fun and entertaining entry for your personal collection. I enjoyed it a lot. But you also won't miss out on a lot if you skip this one.

185233815.review:
Not bad. The game continues were the original Dead Island leaves off. More of the same if you will, which isn't entirely a bad thing if you like the original. There is a big positive and a few negatives though. 

The positive, you can transfer over your character from the original, level and perks all intact.

The negative, still buggy at times with animations and achievements. In new game plus, none of your side quests are saved. I somehow missed one thing and it expects me to replay it all over again from scratch? It's a good game but not that good to hustle for another 10 hours. The other big thing is the game ends abruptly and very weak. There's a whole other part of the last map that is left untouched and it seems like the game was rushed. Shame really. Last thing, the quest tracker is completely broken so keep an eye on the map.

184880176.review: По ощущениям ооочень дерьмовый зомби мод на Фар Край 3 (сужу по графе и настроению в общем). В отличии от ФК3, тут максимально хреновая оптимизация, коллизии и боёвка. Как и в Дайинг Лайт, упор тут делается на боёвку вплотную, но какая же она неудобная. Тупо постоянно идёшь на этого зомби на таран по 10 раз, ожидая пока выносливость заполнится, а ведь на тебя идут толпы. Особенно бесит "удар сверху", кто это придумал. Если в ФК3 ты просто круто ваншотал врага, то тууут... ты можешь застрять в коллизиях недостроенного дома например и тупо в них скользить, так и не нанеся урона, а если ты всё таки попал в зомбя, то урон ему будет как будто ты просто пукнул, заодно он тебя и поцелует. Возможно это всё изза упоротого баланса, но даже с могучейшим молотком для отбивных который я купил и улучшил, он не может наносить значительного уроа зомби-"шпале", забыл как его зовут, короче дылда огромная, вменяемый урон ему можно нанести только прописав в хед огнём ракетницы, а патроны то в дефиците! Играть в игру разве что можно с друзьями, онлайн уже давно умер после раздачи, да и во время онлайна из него меня кикали челики за просто так либо просто афкашили. Из плюсов разве что изменение внешнего вида оружек при улучшениях, типо гвоздей, российская озвучка, НООО... в игре есть кассеты для понимания лора, и это просто 3,14здец полнейший. Они очень тихие, звук им нельзя добавить, поэтому они заглушаются посторонними звуками, а прослушать после этого их больше НЕГДЕ!!! Короче, мой опыт был такой себе, думаю с остальными играми серии не ознакомлюсь, хоть и вторая заманчиво выглядит, хорошо что на раздаче забрал

184865361.review:
Dead Island: Riptide is a perfect follow-up to the first game, continuing the story of the survivors and adding new elements that keep the game feeling fresh and exciting.

One of the first things that struck me about Dead Island Riptide was the improvements in graphics and game-play. The graphics are even more stunning than the first game, with vibrant and detailed environments that really immerse you in the zombie-infested island. The game-play also feels smoother and more polished, making combat and movement feel more fluid and natural.

But what sets Dead Island Riptide apart from the first game is the new island of Palanai. This new location adds a whole new dimension to the game, with different landscapes, dangerous new enemies, and interesting side quests to discover. Exploring this new island is an adventure in itself and adds even more hours of game-play to an already lengthy game.

The characters from the original game also make a return in Riptide, and their stories continue to evolve in interesting and unexpected ways. It was great to see how they have grown and changed since the events of the first game, and also to meet new characters who bring their own unique flavor to the group dynamic.

One of the things that made the original Dead Island so popular was its open-world, RPG style game-play. And this aspect is still present and well-executed in Riptide. The game gives you the freedom to explore, make choices, and improve your character's skills and weapons, making each play-through a unique and personal experience.

Of course, a game like Dead Island Riptide wouldn't be complete without its signature, gory combat. And once again, the game delivers on this front. The variety of weapons available, from the classic machete to electrified axes, makes for some truly satisfying zombie-slaying action. And the addition of new special infected, like the Screamer and the Boomer, adds new challenges and strategies to the game-play.

Overall, Dead Island Riptide is a solid expansion to an already legendary game. It does an excellent job of building upon the foundation of the first game, while also bringing fresh and exciting elements to the table. Whether you are a fan of the original or new to the Dead Island series, this game is a must-play for any zombie game enthusiast.

184836639.review:
时至今日这款游戏已经完全不推荐大家游玩了，无论是付费购买的还是免费领取的，游戏到处都是粗糙、未经打磨的痕迹。
※主角移动起来就好像一个刚从双腿粉碎性骨折中康复过来的病人一样，跑步和走路都有明显生涩感
※游戏经常虚空刷怪，在你的身前、身后、身左、身右，他随时想刷就刷，你根本不知道你清空了一个区域这个区域还是否安全
※开船的体验跟吃屎一样，一旦开船那丧尸就跟苍蝇闻见屎一样蜂拥而至，如果你步行走水路反倒一片和谐。导致开船赶路纯粹是负体验
※比如从高处按f踩丧尸的时候，经常卡住踩不到不说，踩完之后还有个几秒钟的像冬天打出溜滑一样的后摇动作，且无法取消。如果周围有别的丧尸的话，这么长的后摇足以致命
※投掷武器时明明瞄准了丧尸，结果出手的时候就莫名其妙打偏
※老镇电影院守屋顶的战斗，丧尸卡墙里2次
※NPC队友的AI跟弱智一样，只打在自己5米以内的丧尸，五米远外的一概不管，只会看戏
※游戏经常需要你破门而入，然而破门而入的结果往往是进门瞬间就被一堆丧尸群殴
※你攻击丧尸的时候丧尸经常会不出硬直，导致你攻击丧尸的时候丧尸还在攻击你，跟你换血

缺点实在太多，我甚至找不到什么优点，唯一值得一提的优点恐怕也就是打丧尸断肢飙血什么的比较爽吧

184261958.review:
Dead Island: Riptide Definitive Edition is an enhanced version of the 2013 action role-playing game Dead Island: Riptide, developed by Techland and published by Deep Silver. Released in 2017 as part of the Dead Island Definitive Collection, this edition brings the zombie-slaying action of Riptide to modern consoles with improved graphics and performance, offering a more polished version of the original game. The game blends first-person combat, open-world exploration, and RPG elements with a post-apocalyptic zombie setting, following the story of survivors trying to escape the deadly island of Palanai.

Story and Setting

The story of Dead Island: Riptide picks up directly after the events of Dead Island, following the survivors from the previous game as they attempt to escape the infected island. After a perilous journey, the group is stranded on a new island, Palanai, where the zombie outbreak has spread and left the survivors in a similar fight for their lives. The game’s narrative isn't groundbreaking or particularly deep, but it serves its purpose, keeping the player engaged as they venture through various missions to survive.

The setting of Palanai is filled with lush tropical environments, from beaches and jungle areas to more urban locales, though the focus is still on survival in the face of overwhelming odds. The world is large and offers a good amount of exploration, which is ideal for players who enjoy uncovering new locations, completing side quests, and scavenging for supplies. However, the story itself is secondary to the gameplay, and the emotional stakes don't always hit their mark.

Gameplay and Combat

Dead Island: Riptide Definitive Edition delivers the same first-person combat system as the original Dead Island, where players hack, slash, and bludgeon their way through hordes of zombies. The combat is a key feature of the game, and it’s designed to be brutal and satisfying. Players can use a wide array of melee weapons, such as knives, bats, and machetes, as well as firearms like pistols and shotguns. The weapons can be modified with various upgrades to increase damage, durability, and effects, adding a layer of customization and variety to the gameplay.

One of the key mechanics is the stamina bar, which limits the number of attacks players can make before needing to catch their breath. This adds a strategic element to combat, forcing players to consider their attacks carefully rather than just mindlessly swinging at zombies. The hit detection in the combat is solid, and landing hits on enemies feels satisfying, especially when you use the more powerful weapons or upgrades.

The game also offers a cooperative multiplayer mode, allowing players to team up with friends and tackle the zombie apocalypse together. The co-op experience is one of the highlights of Dead Island: Riptide, as players can strategize, share resources, and take on missions together. Fighting off hordes of zombies with friends is a chaotic but enjoyable experience, making the game more fun and engaging. However, the game’s AI companions in single-player mode can sometimes feel a bit lackluster, as they often struggle with pathfinding and can be unhelpful during combat.

Progression and RPG Elements

As with the original Dead Island, Riptide features RPG elements such as character progression, skill trees, and leveling. Players can choose from several different characters, each with unique abilities and skill trees, allowing for different playstyles. The game allows for customization of skills, such as enhancing combat abilities, improving health regeneration, or boosting stamina, allowing for a sense of progression and specialization as players level up their character.

The looting and crafting system is also central to the gameplay. Players can collect materials from the environment and use them to craft weapons, medkits, and various items that will aid them in their survival. Looting is essential to making progress, as it gives players the tools they need to defeat tougher zombies and survive the harsh environments of Palanai. While the crafting system adds depth and creativity to the gameplay, it can become a bit repetitive over time, especially when combined with the game’s reliance on fetch quests and grinding for resources.

Graphics and Performance

The Definitive Edition of Dead Island: Riptide offers a visual upgrade over the original game. The environments are more detailed, with better textures and lighting, and the overall presentation is much cleaner. The tropical setting comes to life with vibrant colors, although the game still retains a somewhat dated look compared to modern open-world games. The upgrade is noticeable, but it’s not groundbreaking—it’s still very much a game that feels rooted in the last generation of consoles.

The character models and animations are improved, though they still exhibit some awkward moments, especially in the cutscenes. The game struggles with occasional clipping issues, and there are moments when the AI feels stiff, but the overall visual fidelity is better than the original release. The world of Dead Island: Riptide is immersive enough, though some areas can feel repetitive in terms of design, especially with the large sections of jungle and similar environments.

Sound Design and Atmosphere

The sound design in Dead Island: Riptide is effective but not extraordinary. The game features a mix of ambient sounds, such as the crashing of waves, rustling leaves, and distant animal noises that create a somewhat atmospheric environment. The sound of zombies groaning and shuffling through the foliage adds tension and helps maintain the sense of dread throughout the game.

The soundtrack is serviceable, with action-oriented music that plays during combat, and quieter, more ambient pieces during exploration. The voice acting is adequate but nothing particularly memorable, and some of the character dialogue feels somewhat forced or cliché. While the sound design helps set the tone for the game, it doesn’t elevate the experience to the level of truly immersive survival horror games.

Weaknesses

1. Repetitive Gameplay: The game relies heavily on fetch quests, looting, and grinding, which can become repetitive over time.
2. Uninspired Story: The plot and character development are weak, and the game doesn't do much to emotionally invest players in the characters.
3. AI Issues: The AI companions can sometimes be unhelpful or awkward, detracting from the experience.
4. Limited Visual Upgrade: While the game looks better than its original release, it’s still not up to par with modern open-world games.

Strengths

1. Satisfying Combat: The first-person combat system is fun, brutal, and engaging, especially with weapon upgrades and modifications.
2. Co-op Mode: The co-op multiplayer is a blast, adding a layer of fun and chaos when playing with friends.
3. Character Progression: The RPG elements, such as skill trees and looting, provide a sense of progression and customization.
4. Atmosphere: The tropical island setting, paired with solid sound design, creates a somewhat immersive environment.

Conclusion

Dead Island: Riptide Definitive Edition is an enjoyable, if flawed, experience. The game’s focus on first-person combat, character progression, and co-op multiplayer make it a fun time for fans of zombie action. The visuals have been improved, and the combat is satisfying, though the story and AI companions leave something to be desired. The repetitive gameplay loop and lack of an engaging narrative may turn some players off, but for those looking for a fun, action-packed zombie survival game, Dead Island: Riptide Definitive Edition offers a solid, if imperfect, experience.

184044370.review: Я уже говорил тебе, что такое безумие, а? Безумие – это точное повторение одного и того же действия. Раз за разом, в надежде на изменение. Это есть безумие. Когда впервые я это услышал, не помню, кто сказал эту хрень, я, бум, убил его. Смысл в том, окей, он был прав. И тогда я стал видеть это везде. Везде, куда ни глянь – эти болваны. Куда ни глянь, делают точно одно и то же, снова и снова, и снова, и снова. И думают: «Сейчас все изменится. Не-не-не, прошу. Сейчас все будет иначе.»

前作よりもグラが綺麗になり、ハイテンションでテンポも良く好印象なスタート。「おもろくなったやん！」と感じながら遊ぶこと数時間。いつの間にか笑顔が消える..(￣-￣;)ｳｰﾝ

改善点もありグラ表現も増してるけど、相変わらず調整不足でガバガーバな印象。小間使い感マシマシに耐えながら、最後は訳わからん展開で面食らい、意外とあっさりなエンドに草ボーボー。までもそれが「Dead Island」なんだよなー的なｗ　あくまで本作は過去作であり、その時代を盛り上げてくれたのは間違いないタイトル。時代を作り上げてきた人達にリスペクト心があるのでサムズダウンはしませぬ。
まぁ「ブツクサ..ブツクサ..」言いながらも、結果的に最後までやってた訳だから、それなりに楽しめていたのかと。（他人ごと）要望があるとしたらもう少しエロフレーバーを増してほしかったが、2で大化けしたんで◎(｡･ω･｡)♡

実況動画などを見ると「人体の部位●損」に触れている物を多く見かける。やはり本作はそこだーな。

183642096.review:
Sehr schönes Spiel was Grafik und Inszenierung angeht. Tolle Welt, blutige Zombies, wuchtige Waffen. Für Leute, die sich gerne durch Zombiehorden schlagen, ein perfekter Deal.
Für mich persönlich hört es da aber dann auch schon auf mit den Pluspunkten.
Die Steuerung fühlt sich zwar halbwegs realistisch an, dadurch aber leider auch sehr schwammig. Dementsprechend macht das Erkunden auch nur halb so viel Spaß.
Die Story und Quests sind zwar nett, aber auf jeden Fall nicht der Kernpunkt des Spiels.
Zombies respawnen, sobald man nur ein paar Meter in eine andere Richtung geht. Da die Waffen auch dauerhaft an Haltbarkeit verlieren, ein eher nerviges Unterfangen.

Leider überwiegt hier für mich das negative. Wahrscheinlich nur für Leute geeignet, die den Vorgänger gespielt haben und/oder sich mit der komischen Steuerung und den fummeligen Menüs abfinden können.

183574782.review:
-TLDR: Só vale a pena se quiser saber o final da história, jogo extremamente cansativo.

- O jogo tem o mesmo desempenho do primeiro (drops de fps aqui e ali, mesmo em PCs parrudos).
- O mapa é péssimo, extenso e com grande parte de pântano na primeira parte, o que obriga a ir pra lá e pra cá com um barco lento.
- A segunda parte do mapa é na cidade, pensada para se jogar com parkour do Dying light, mas com a movimentação amarrada do Dead Island. Os marcadores do mapa muitas vezes não traçam o caminho por conta de barreiras de caixas que foram feitas para zombies não passarem, mas nisso o "GPS" não mostra a rota, tem que ficar pausando o jogo constantemente.

-Os zombies acertam 1 ou 2 golpes e já matam, acertam de muito longe, muitíssimo desequilibrado em comparação com o primeiro. Ainda tem os zombies que jogam armas de corpo a corpo em você e é hit kill (chato pra cacete).

-Zerei em 15h fazendo várias missões secundárias para conseguir nível.

-O úlimo boss é apelativo de mais, se movimenta e ataca 1000% mais rápido que você.

-Foi extremamente cansativo zerar este, diferente do primeiro.
